alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued August 05 at 3:27PM AKDT until August 05 at 7:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * LOCATION...Kuskokwim Delta and Nunivak Island * COASTAL FLOODING...Water levels are expected to rise during high tides, 3 to 5 feet above normal highest tide. * TIMING...Until 7 PM AKDT this evening. West of Kipnuk, including Nunivak Island, can experience two tidal peaks above normal highest tide early this morning and again this afternoon. Kipnuk eastward will peak this afternoon. * IMPACTS...South to southeasterly winds with gusts of 45 to 60 mph from a strong storm for this time of year. The resulting higher seas and surf, coinciding with high tide, will raise the potential for both flooding among low lying areas and coastal erosion for communities along the Kuskokwim Delta coast and Nunivak Island.
info.instruction: A coastal flood advisory indicates that onshore winds and tides will combine to generate flooding of low areas along the shore.
